p: It has been reported that the daily intake of isoflavones in Asia varies among regions and subpopulation in the same country, ranging from 15 to 50 mg. This is also supported by results of other research studies in which it was stated that the daily isoflavone intake among Southeast Asians was between 15 and 47 mg [ 16, 17, 18]. However, in Western countries, people have been found to consume far less isoflavones, between 0.15 mg and 1.7 mg per day [ 19, 20, 21].
